ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Possible brain stem lesion / Central auditory disorder
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Normal hearing sensitivity and normal ipsilateral reflexes combined with absent contralateral reflexes suggest involvement of crossover pathways in the brain stem.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity across frequencies.
To measure speech recognition thresholds and scores in quiet.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and brainstem crossover pathways.
To assess middle ear compliance and pressure.
To assess neural integrity of the auditory pathway.
To confirm cochlear outer hair cell function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates normal bilateral hearing sensitivity and excellent speech recognition in quiet. Middle ear function is normal, as are cochlear emissions (TEOAEs) and ABR waveforms. However, a specific abnormality is noted in acoustic reflex testing: while ipsilateral reflexes are present at normal levels, contralateral reflexes are absent bilaterally. This dissociation suggests a retrocochlear pathology specifically affecting the crossover pathways in the brainstem.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally; thresholds 0-10 dB HL across 250-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 0 dB HL, SRS 98%; Left SRT 5 dB HL, SRS 100%.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Ipsilateral reflexes present (Right 85 dB HL, Left 90 dB HL); Contralateral reflexes absent bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal static compliance (Right 0.72 cc, Left 0.80 cc).

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: All waves normal; interpeak latencies and latency-intensity functions normal.

tests.name: Tone decay test
tests.result_summary: No significant decay (0 dB right, 5 dB left in 60 seconds at 4000 Hz).

proposed_items: Reschedule for a complete battery of special tests for central auditory disorders (AMLR, PI-PB functions, SSI-ICM, SSI-CCM, staggered spondaic words)
counseling_actions: Explain that the difficulty is not due to sounds being too soft (normal pure tones) but likely due to processing within the brainstem.
Explain that additional stress must be placed on speech recognition ability to determine the extent of the difficulty.

red_flags_present: Absent contralateral acoustic reflexes with normal ipsilateral reflexes

escalation.rationale_short: Imperative to rule out neurological issues or lesions affecting the auditory brainstem pathways.

follow_up_plan.objective: Perform central auditory processing test battery and refer to neurology.
